FuncDef:
The qos tm-schedule traffic-statistics command enables a device to collect packet statistics based on accuracy compensated lengths.
The undo qos tm-schedule traffic-statistics command disables a device from collecting packet statistics based on accuracy compensated lengths.
By default, a device is enabled to collect packet statistics based on accuracy compensated lengths.
CLIs: qos tm-schedule traffic-statistics adjustment-packet slot <slot-id> card <card-id>
undo qos tm-schedule traffic-statistics adjustment-packet slot <slot-id> card <card-id>

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a subcard ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 3.

Based adjustment packet length for traffic statistics.
-

Specifies the slot ID of an interface board.
-

Examples: [~HUAWEI] qos tm-schedule traffic-statistics adjustment-packet slot 1 card 1
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Only data in a packet is useful. Protocol encapsulation in the packet is link overload. Therefore, a device can be enabled to collect packet statistics based on accuracy compensated lengths, improving statistics accuracy. To enable this function, run the qos tm-schedule traffic-statistics command.
For the LPUF120-E/LPUF240-E, statistics are collected based on the packet length before precise compensation by default.
This function takes effect only in the per-packet accuracy compensation scenario, not in the fragment accuracy compensation scenario.
In VS mode, this command applies only to the admin VSand cannot be configured in other VSs. This command takes effect on all VSs.
